Brain Test: Tricky Puzzles is a collection of short, lateral‑thinking riddles where the obvious answer is rarely correct. You interact with the scene directly—drag items, combine them, move text, or reveal things hidden off screen—to find the trick that solves the level. 4th and Goal 2022 distills American football into brisk drives and meaningful decisions. The playbook is compact but expressive: inside runs to set a rhythm, option looks that punish over‑pursuit, and timing routes that reward a calm read when a safety bites. On defense, a well‑chosen blitz can flip a possession, while disciplined coverage squeezes windows until a hurried throw invites a takeaway.

Modes range from quick games to deeper playoff runs, and the tone stays consistent—intuitive controls, short possessions, and enough tactical space that smart play‑calling tells. Drives hinge on small choices: take the yards and bleed the clock, or push for a dagger before the half; pin them deep with field position, or gamble on fourth down when momentum is yours. Red‑zone snaps carry that familiar knot in the stomach, and touchdowns feel earned rather than scripted. It’s football trimmed to essentials, lively and readable, where a season’s story is written in a handful of clutch plays.

PolyTrack is a fast-paced browser racing game that challenges your precision, timing, and nerves. Built with HTML5, it runs instantly in your browser—no downloads, no installs, just pure racing.
The game features a clean low-poly visual style paired with tight, physics-driven controls. Each track is designed to push you to the limit, with loops, jumps, sharp turns, and high-risk shortcuts that reward skillful driving and perfect execution. The goal is simple but addictive: finish as fast as possible and beat your best time.
PolyTrack is all about time-trial racing. There are no power-ups or random elements—every improvement comes from learning the track, optimizing your racing line, and mastering speed control. Shaving off milliseconds becomes incredibly satisfying, especially when you finally nail a flawless run.
For players who love creativity, PolyTrack also includes a track editor, allowing you to build, share, and race custom tracks made by the community. This keeps the experience fresh and endlessly replayable.
If you enjoy games like TrackMania or skill-based racing where mastery matters more than upgrades, PolyTrack delivers a pure, skill-driven racing experience that’s easy to start and hard to put down.

PolyTrack, PolyTrack Pizza Edition, racing game

Movement
•	W / ↑ — Accelerate
•	S / ↓ — Brake / Reverse
•	A / ← — Steer left
•	D / → — Steer right

Game Controls
•	R — Restart the current run
•	Space — Brake / Handbrake (used for tighter turns)

Other
•	Mouse / Touch — Menu navigation and track editor interactions
•	Gamepad — Supported on some browsers (analog steering and throttle)

In practice, most competitive players rely heavily on R (restart) to optimize runs and handbrake control to manage sharp corners and speed balance.

Escape Road is a fast-paced arcade driving game set in a distinctive Minecraft-inspired blocky world. You control a car racing through cubic roads and pixelated city layouts while being relentlessly chased by the police. Block-shaped buildings, vehicles, and environments give the game a playful visual style that contrasts with the intense pressure of the pursuit.
Gameplay is focused on quick reactions and clean driving. Traffic fills the narrow roads, sharp turns appear without warning, and a single mistake can end the run. There are no complicated mechanics—your survival depends entirely on how well you steer, avoid obstacles, and use the blocky road layout to shake off the police.
As the chase continues, the difficulty steadily increases, demanding sharper reflexes and better control. With instant restarts, simple controls, and short, adrenaline-filled sessions, Escape Road is easy to jump into but hard to put down. The combination of tense arcade driving and a familiar voxel-style aesthetic makes it appealing to both casual players and fans of Minecraft-like visuals.

Tank Trouble 2 is an explosive maze-based shooter that turns simple geometry into a deadly weapon. Terris is a fast-paced, modern tribute to the world’s most famous block-stacking puzzle game. The goal is simple yet infinitely challenging: arrange falling geometric shapes (Tetriminos) to create solid horizontal lines. Once a line is completed, it vanishes, earning you points and preventing the screen from filling up. As your score increases, the speed of the falling blocks intensifies, requiring lightning-fast reflexes and spatial awareness. This version features clean, minimalist graphics and smooth animations, making it an excellent choice for both casual play and high-score chasing. Whether you're a veteran player looking to practice your 'T-spin' techniques or a newcomer, Terris delivers a timeless arcade experience.
